docs.lead_paragraph: Many long-term-care policies offer less generous benefits for care overseas, while at least one offers full coverage but may charge higher premiums.

headline.main: How Retiring Abroad Could Affect Your Long-Term-Care Insurance

docs.lead_paragraph: Guidelines presume we doctors always know the best treatment. We don’t.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Dr Sandeep Jauhar contends effort to homogenize health care with dizzying array of treatment guidelines makes sense in some instances but not others; holds utilizing standard treatment presumes that doctors always understand which treatments are best, which is not the case; says next step in improving health care quality will entail personalizing care instead of homogenizing it.
docs.snippet: Guidelines presume we doctors always know the best treatment. We don’t.

docs.lead_paragraph: Two-thirds of women who have lumpectomies for breast cancer are receiving radiation treatment that lasts nearly twice as long as necessary, research shows.

headline.main: Long Radiation Treatments Called Unnecessary in Many Breast Cancer Cases
headline.print_headline: Long Radiation Treatments Called Unnecessary in Many Breast Cancer Cases

docs.abstract: Study published in Journal of American Medical Assn finds two-thirds of women who undergo lumpectomies for breast cancer are getting radiation treatment that lasts almost twice as long as is needed; studies show three to four weeks of radiation is just as effective as conventional treatment of five to seven weeks.
docs.snippet: Two-thirds of women who have lumpectomies for breast cancer are receiving radiation treatment that lasts nearly twice as long as necessary, research shows.

keywords.value: Journal of the American Medical Assn
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration says sign-ups picked up last week under the president's health care law.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. government said on Wednesday that 618,548 individuals selected a 2015 health plan on HealthCare.Gov during the week of Nov. 29 to Dec. 5, of which 48 percent were consumers who had not previously purchased this insurance.

headline.main: HealthCare.gov Sign-Ups Grow in Week Three of 2015 Enrollment: Government
headline.print_headline: HealthCare.gov Sign-Ups Grow in Week Three of 2015 Enrollment: Government

docs.lead_paragraph: The Northern Arapaho tribe filed a federal lawsuit Tuesday alleging that proposed Internal Revenue Service rules could cause Native Americans to pay higher insurance premiums or lose health care benefits.

headline.main: Northern Arapaho Sue Over IRS Health Care Rule

docs.lead_paragraph: Top lawmakers Tuesday released a massive 1,603-page, $1.1 trillion omnibus spending bill funding every government agency but the Homeland Security Department through Sept. 30, 2015. The measure also contains dozens of policy provisions affecting financial regulations, the environment, school lunches and regulations requiring truckers get more rest. Provisions include:

docs.lead_paragraph: Exposed to the light of day, a year-end, $1.1 trillion spending bill drew vociferous objections from liberals and milder criticism from conservatives on Wednesday while lawmakers readied a brief, stopgap measure to prevent a government shutdown both parties vowed to avoid.
